intro: Hordelymus caput-medusae, commonly known as the crown of thorns, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family, known for its succulent leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are fleshy and often have a waxy coating, which helps it retain water in arid environments. The plant is also noted for its ability to thrive in rocky, well-drained soils.
